news.title: Bengaluru: Greywater recycling to become mandatory for new buildings, houses
news.para: Authorities will enforce greywater treatment for kitchens, bathrooms, and laundry in new residential  projects, helping recharge groundwater and reduce dependence on distant  river supplies

news.title: Residents of Bengaluru’s AECS Layout seek action against illegal high-rises
news.para: Frustrated by water shortages, traffic, and crime, volunteers in AECS Layout identified 30 high-rise buildings allegedly violating GBA norms, exceeding sanctioned floor plans. Despite submitting complaints, these structures were completed, leading to infrastructure strain and calls for demolition and utility disconnections.

news.title: Pay 11% interest to buyer for delay in flat handover: Haryana RERA to Agrante Realty
news.para: A Gurugram Rera bench has ordered Agrante Realty to pay 10.9% annual interest to a homebuyer. The builder failed to deliver a flat in the Kavyam project despite receiving almost full payment. Rera rejected the builder's excuses for the delay. The authority is taking a strict approach towards delayed affordable housing projects.

news.title: Country Garden secures $1.14 billion loan-to-equity conversion as part of restructuring
news.para: Country Garden's controlling shareholder will convert $1.14 billion in loans to equity as part of its offshore debt restructuring, with shares issued at a slight premium. The developer faces creditor votes on its plan in November, with a court hearing for a liquidation petition scheduled for January 2026.

news.title: Delhi civic body cuts water, power supply at Signature View Apartments as deadline to vacate ends
news.para: Electricity and water supply to Delhi's Signature View Apartments have been disconnected by the MCD and DDA after a court-set deadline passed, with 51 residents still on the premises. The complex, deemed structurally unsafe by IIT-Delhi, faces demolition and reconstruction, though a demolition tender update is pending.

news.title: DLF denies claims of water supply issues in its malls in Vasant Kunj
news.para: DLF has denied reports of water supply issues at DLF Promenade and DLF Emporio malls in Vasant Kunj. The real estate company stated that both malls have adequate water supply and robust contingency measures. Teams are working with authorities to ensure uninterrupted services during the festive season. Delhi Jal Board officials confirmed the issue has been resolved.

news.title: Signature Global reports pre-sales of ₹46.5 billion in H1 FY26
news.para: Signature Global reported robust pre-sales of ₹46.5 billion in H1 FY26, with collections reaching ₹18.7 billion. The company's net debt saw a slight increase due to land acquisition in Sohna, a move expected to fuel future development. Despite this, Signature Global remains confident in sustaining growth and meeting its annual targets.

news.title: Embassy Developments' promoters complete ₹1,160 crore fund infusion
news.para: Embassy Developments' promoters have fully subscribed to warrants, injecting a final ₹67.7 crore and bringing the total promoter infusion to ₹1,160 crore. This investment, converting warrants into equity at ₹111.51 per share, strengthens the company's balance sheet and supports ongoing and future expansion. The infusion increases promoter shareholding in EDL to 41.4%.

news.title: SC to hear on Tuesday Sahara firm's plea seeking nod for sale of assets to Adani Properties
news.para: Sahara India Commercial Corporation Ltd. has approached the Supreme Court seeking approval to sell properties, including Amby Valley and Shahara Saher, to Adani Properties Private Limited. The plea highlights the group's efforts to liquidate assets to meet court-ordered financial obligations and repay depositors.

news.title: SC refuses to entertain plea by Asian Paints against CCI probe into market abuse charges
news.para: The Supreme Court has refused to entertain Asian Paints' plea against a Competition Commission of India (CCI) investigation into alleged abuse of its dominant market position. The CCI's probe, initiated following a complaint by Grasim Industries, will proceed as directed by the Bombay High Court.

news.title: China Vanke's chairman resigns
news.para: China Vanke Chairman Xin Jie resigned over the weekend, with director Huang Liping taking over as the new chairman. Vanke's shares fell in early trading following the announcement. Xin's departure comes less than a year after his appointment, amid the company's ongoing struggles within China's troubled property sector.

news.title: Arnya Realestates Fund Advisors invests ₹415 crore across residential projects
news.para: Arnya Realestates Fund Advisors has invested ₹415 crore in new housing projects. These projects are located in Bengaluru and Navi Mumbai. The fund's total assets now exceed ₹675 crore. Deployments are expected to reach ₹1,200 crore by March 2026. A new residential equity fund is also targeting ₹1,000 crore.

news.title: MYK LATICRETE: 25 years of innovation in tile & stone installation industry
news.para: MYK LATICRETE has transformed India's tile and stone installation industry by championing technology and innovation. The company offers advanced adhesives, grouts, and eco-friendly solutions, supporting large-format tiles and urban growth. Through installer training and rigorous R&D, MYK LATICRETE ensures global standards and contributes to India's infrastructure development.

news.title: Rama World: Redefining Chhattisgarh's commercial and lifestyle landscape
news.para: Central India is experiencing a significant transformation, with Rama World in Chhattisgarh emerging as a pivotal integrated development. This landmark project by Rama Group seamlessly blends retail, business, leisure, and lifestyle, offering a world-class destination.  It aims to fuel regional growth by attracting premium brands and catering to the rising aspirations of consumers in Tier-2 cities.

news.title: Neil Nitin Mukesh and his father buy ₹11.35 crore apartment in Mumbai
news.para: Actor Neil Nitin Mukesh and his father Nitin Mukesh have purchased a luxurious apartment in Mumbai's World One tower. The property deal was valued at ₹11.35 crore. This significant transaction includes a spacious apartment and two car parking spaces. The registration documents reveal a stamp duty payment of ₹68.10 lakh. The deal was officially registered in July 2025.

news.title: Ghaziabad: Higher FAR, mixed land use set to boost TOD zone revenue by 200%
news.para: Ghaziabad's rapid rail corridor will see significant revenue boosts with the implementation of the transit-oriented development policy. The policy increases floor area ratio by 33-50% and allows mixed land use, projected to raise revenue by over 200%. Ghaziabad Development Authority and NCRTC will share this revenue equally.

news.title: Houses constructed by slum development board to be distributed in Hubballi in November
news.para: Karnataka will distribute 42,346 houses on November 29 in Hubballi. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will lead the grand event. The state government is bearing beneficiary contributions for house construction. This initiative aims to provide homes to the poor. The government is committed to completing housing projects. The Chief Minister will serve his full term.

news.title: Chandigarh administration faces new hurdles for projects exceeding ₹1.5 crore
news.para: Chandigarh's engineering department has identified priority projects, including new schools and a PU-PGI underpass, awaiting financial approval from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). This follows an MHA order withdrawing powers for projects exceeding Rs 1.5 crore and tender acceptance from UT officials, causing procedural confusion. Departments are seeking exemptions for routine repair and maintenance works.

news.title: Maan-Mhalunge planning scheme awaits Maharashtra government’s nod
news.para: The Mhalunge-Maan town planning scheme, a flagship project showcased in 2018, remains stalled despite renewed directives, leaving hundreds of landowners in uncertainty.  Officials cite pending state government clearance, while affected residents express frustration over their inability to develop or sell their land, demanding immediate action or a clear explanation for the delay.

news.title: Unplanned construction, climate fury wreck Darjeeling
news.para: Unregulated construction and deforestation, exacerbated by climate change, have caused widespread devastation in Darjeeling's hills, particularly Mirik.  Incessant rains triggered massive landslides, claiming over 30 lives and displacing numerous families. The Chief Minister is reviewing restoration efforts and providing aid to affected communities.
